reviews.review: This was a fantastic movie from start to finish!  One of the best of the entire saga.  It wrapped everything up in the series and was fun to watch.

As a longtime fan I actually loved this movie. There were a lot of flaws, but I still feel it corrected a lot of wrongs TLJ made. Some of the best moments of Star Wars are in this movie. Far from perfect, but very enjoyable for me.
It easily could’ve been split into 2 or 3 movies, but overall, it was a fitting ending!

Rise of Skywalker does it's best to repair what The Last Jedi left behind, but the execution tells us that they needed to extend it to 4 movies to really do this in an impactful way. A lot of the "fixes" are alright and actually what the fans wanted but its executed in such a way that the viewer is constantly saying: "Umm... okay" and "how?"
In the midst of trying to repair the damage the last movie caused to the plot and also to continue a new series of story arcs, the movie often explains away things by "this happens just because we say so." To top it off it gets so fanservice-y that it's obvious what they are doing, so many "heartfelt" moments but actually weren't because the movie takes away from the moments with events that happen later/earlier in it's own film. Not to mention a lot of the gripes that people had with TLJ were answered in this one but with varying levels of success, most of them being added just to be there to satisfy critics.

Still parsing my feelings on some of the larger plot arcs - I loved when Ray's parents were 'nobody' - a sentiment that empowers the viewers and fans. More importantly, the movie had no breathing room and therefore played like an Avengers movie, not a Star Wars movie. The final movie of the Skywalker saga should have been filled with deep emotional impact, but because Abrams yanked us around so much, there was no time to process any of the bombshell plot developments. Sadly, I felt this was John Williams' most forgettable Star Wars score, which felt like nothing more than fan service when it wasn't trying to keep up with the chaotic pace. This was a movie for Star Wars populists, and had nothing visionary to offer.
Exciting close to the Skywalker saga. I’ll be watching this one again.
The film was like a bad fanfiction come to life. However; some of the visual effects were impressive.
Awesome! Excellent conclusion - very emotionally satisfying!
very entertaining! little cheesy and fan servicesy,  but good overall. great action. story was little rushed tho.
